recipeIngredient: 30 mL avocado oil or neutral-flavored oil
15 to 20 fresh or 30 dried curry leaves
1 large yellow or red onion, finely diced
5 cm piece fresh ginger, minced or grated
10 mL Diamond Crystal kosher salt (adjust if using other salts)
850 g (2 cans) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
2.5 mL organic cane sugar, brown sugar, or coconut sugar
200-230 g (1 small head) Swiss chard or lacinato kale, ribs removed and thinly sliced
7.5 to 15 mL freshly squeezed lemon or lime juice, to taste
1 large handful of chopped cilantro leaves and tender stems
1 large handful of chopped fresh mint leaves

text.content: Heat 30 mL oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add coriander and cumin seeds, toast for 1 minute until fragrant. Add curry leaves, cover briefly. Add diced onion with a pinch of salt and cook for 5 minutes. Add garlic, ginger, and serrano peppers, cook for 1-2 minutes.
Stir in ground spices and tomato paste for 90 seconds. Add diced tomatoes and 10 mL salt, cook for 5 minutes until soft and oil releases.
Pour in chickpeas, coconut milk, water, tahini, and sugar. Stir well, bring to a simmer, then cover and cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the thinly sliced Swiss chard or kale to the simmering curry. Cook for 4-5 minutes until tender. Stir in garam masala.
Remove from heat. Stir in lemon or lime juice, chopped cilantro, and mint. Season with additional salt to taste. Let rest for 5-15 minutes before serving with rice or flatbread.
